availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Elias Wood and Jane Adams Wood. Married to Mary Jane Burkhart Wood on October 24, 1852. Father of William Wood, Lilly Wood, and Mattie Wood. Attorney in Pulaski County, Kentucky, in 1860. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Practiced law in partnership with L. A. Civill in Louisville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski, Somerset, District 1, p. 6.
Tanner’s Louisville Directory, and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Henry Tanner, 1861), 267.
“Lawyer L.A. Wood,” Louisville Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), Dec. 3, 1886, p. 2.
"Remains Will Be Sent to Falls City," The Kentucky Post (Covington, KY), January 19, 1904, p. 3.
Eugene L. Wood, Some Descendants of the Adams, Floyd and Wood Families of Pulaski and Casey Counties of Kentucky (Albuquerque, NM: 1967), p. 128.
